snippet: The loss of childhood memories may be the result of the constant birth of new neurons in the brain, research with rodents suggests.
abstract: Katherine Akers study in journal Science suggests that inability of adults to recall experiences from childhood may be linked to creation of new neurons in brain that drive the loss of early memories.
lead_paragraph: The loss of childhood memories may be the result of the constant birth of new neurons in the brain, research with rodents suggests.

headline.print_headline: Biology: New Neurons Found to Overwrite Old Memories
headline.main: New Neurons Found to Overwrite Old Memories
